text: St Mary's Church is a Roman-gothic church in Vau i Dejës, Shkodër, Albania. It was built in the 12th century and destroyed in 1969. The building was listed as a culture monument of Albania. == History == The church was built in the 12th century. It was the place where the national hero Gjergj Kastriot Skenderbeg married. It was blown up on May 30, 1969, with the order of Fadil Ymeri. Gani Stratizmiri filed a lawsuit to prosecutor, because at the time where the church was destroyed, it was a culture monument for about 20 years, and it was carrying a sign that read protect by the state. Prosecutor justified authors on the grounds that they acted without knowing that the church was a culture monument. == Current status == 1000 lek note, 1996 version, showing the church The church has been reconstructed near the old church ruins. The church is illustrated on the 1996 1000 lek currency note. == References == Category:Roman Catholic churches in Shkodër Category:Destroyed churches
title: St Mary's Church, Vau i Dejës
